articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's consumer prices fell into deflation in July, while factory gate prices extended their declines, as the world's second-largest economy struggled to revive demand and pressure mounted for authorities to release more direct stimulus.
articles.title: China swings into deflation as recovery falters

articles.author: Tom Sims
articles.description: Germany has long benefited from an era of cheap money that fuelled a decade-long boom in real estate, but now the sector is grappling with a major turn of fortune.
articles.title: Why Germany's property sector is in the dumps

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italy has set a cap at 0.1% of total bank assets for the new tax targeting profits lenders reaped from higher rates, after the surprise announcement of the new levy sparked a market sell-off on Tuesday.
articles.title: Italy sets 0.1% cap for new bank tax after market rout

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday that more than 460 companies have expressed interested in winning government semiconductor subsidy funding in a bid to boost the country's competitiveness with China's science and technology efforts.
articles.title: US reports big interest in $52 billion semiconductor chips funding

articles.author: Karen Freifeld, David Shepardson
articles.description: The White House on Wednesday will detail its plans to prohibit some U.S. investments in sensitive technology in China, and require that the government be notified of other investments, a senior government source told Reuters.
articles.title: White House to detail plans restricting some US investments in China - source

articles.author: Echo Wang, Anirban Sen
articles.description: Amazon.com (AMZN.O) is in talks about joining other technology companies as a cornerstone investor in SoftBank Group Corp's (9984.T) Arm Ltd ahead of its initial public offering (IPO), people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Amazon in talks to become anchor investor in Arm ahead of IPO

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: In contrast to the 1970s, much of today's political violence is aimed at people, not property. And most deadly attacks tracked by Reuters come from the right--such as a Trump fan who shot a neighbor.
articles.title: Political violence in polarized U.S. at its worst since 1970s

articles.author: Boureima Balima
articles.description: A former rebel leader and politician in Niger has launched a movement opposing the junta that took power in a July 26 coup, a first sign of internal resistance to army rule in the strategically important Sahel country.
articles.title: Niger ex-rebel launches anti-coup movement in first sign of internal resistance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Forty-one migrants have been killed in a shipwreck off Italy's Lampedusa island, the ANSA news agency reported on Wednesday, citing accounts from survivors.
articles.title: Forty-one dead in migrant shipwreck off Italy's Lampedusa island - Ansa
